map
directive in module maps

Description

A directive for embedding google maps into an app

Usage

as attribute
<ANY map
     [center]="{expression}"
     pan="{string|boolean}"
     control="{object}"
     [zoom]="{expression|number}"
     draggable="{string|boolean}"
     options="{expression|object}"
     events="{expression|object}">
   ...
</ANY>

Parameters

ParamTypeDetails
[center]expression

Expression to evaluate as an object representing the map center. May be in the form of an object containing latitude and longitude properties.

panstringboolean

This attribute is a flag indicate how the map's centering should behave. This tells the map to use map.panTo instead of map.setCenter. (Animate to center via pan or not.)

Note: Evaluated on the attribute only. This is not watched on the scope

(default: false)

controlobject

If this attribute is passed it will bind a few methods to the passed object

getMap()
returns a direct reference to the map of the directive

More to possibly come....

(default: undefined)

[zoom]expressionnumber

expression to evaluate as the maps zoom level (1-20)

draggablestringboolean

marks the map as draggable

(default: true)

optionsexpressionobject

options to pass to the initialization of the map to be copied to the initial set of map options

(default: {})

eventsexpressionobject

Custom events to apply to the map. This is an associative array, where keys are event names and values are handler functions.

The handler function takes three parameters:

map
the GoogleMap object
eventName
the name of the event
arguments
the arguments provided by Google Maps for this event type. See the Google Map Event docs

(default: {})
